unnormalised: But, let's be real, it's not all sunshine and rainbows. How many times have you added something to your cart on Amazon, only to see the final amount jump up because of "shipping charges" and "convenience fees"? A friend told me she bought a phone cover for Rs. 299, but the final bill came to Rs. 450. That's almost a 50% increase! These platforms gotta be more transparent, no?

unnormalised: And then there are the discount offers that are, well, not really discounts. I saw a mixer-grinder listed for Rs. 3999 with a "20% off" sticker. Checked the original price? It was Rs. 4200! These e-commerce companies and their marketing tricks, hai Allah! I feel like I need a PhD in deciphering deals now.

unnormalised: Delivery delays are another big headache. I ordered a book on 10/07/2024 and it was supposed to arrive by 15/07/2024. Guess what? It finally showed up on 20/07/2024. When I contacted customer service, all I got was some automated response about "unforeseen circumstances." I mean, come on!

unnormalised: Still, despite the hiccups, e-commerce is here to stay. The convenience of shopping from home, especially during the monsoon or those crazy Delhi summers, is unbeatable. Just be smart, compare prices, read the fine print, and maybe keep a calculator handy. You wouldn't want to end up paying Rs 1000 for a Rs 500 item. Happy shopping, folks!
